Swann to Agar, SIX runs take that, says Ashton Agar! You could see him wind up early for this, lofts it beautifully over long-off for six.
Swann to Agar, no run slower and wider from Swann, Agar leaves it alone
Swann to Agar, no run Agar goes for a cover drive now but can't find the gap
Swann to Agar, no run quicker from Swann, good ball, attacking the stumps, but it's defended
Finn to Hughes, 1 run on the pads now and Hughes tucks it through the leg side for a run
Finn to Agar, no run driven straight to cover along the ground

Finn to Agar, FOUR runs more runs for Agar! Finn bangs it in short again and Agar, as he has shown all innings, has no fear of the bouncer, pulls it over square leg for four more runs. Really poor bowling, that
Finn to Agar, no run short once again, but this time Agar decides to duck it instead of playing
Finn to Agar, no run Agar goes for a square drive now but can't get this past the man at point
Finn to Agar, 2 runs clipped through the leg side - and I do mean through, because the fielder at midwicket has misfielded and turned a single into a two
Swann to Hughes, no run Swann continues to attack the stumps, drifting in from around the wicket, but Hughes defends
Swann to Hughes, no run defended once more from on the stumps
Swann to Hughes, 1 run a little shorter from Swann, Hughes goes back and drives through the gap at cover
Swann to Agar, FOUR runs more runs for Agar, it was tossed up outside off by Swann and Agar has driven it confidently through cover for another boundary
Swann to Agar, no run fuller ball now and Agar drives to the off side
Swann to Agar, no run ah, this one beats the outside edge! Good ball from Swann, turning it just enough
Finn to Hughes, no run Finn is over the wicket to Hughes, who defends from off stump
Finn to Hughes, 1 run Hughes gets some width from Finn, he tries for a cut but doesn't time it, though still picks up a single

Finn to Agar, FOUR runs more short stuff, and more runs for Agar. He has gone for the hook and found the gap between the men at deep square leg and fine leg. It's all looking a bit too easy for Agar here
Finn to Agar, no run defended away safely to the off side

Finn to Agar, FOUR runs Finn goes full this time, which is where he should be bowling, but Agar is up to the challenge and pushes a crunchy drive through point, it has run away almost to the boundary - in fact, the dive from the fielder hasn't saved it
Finn to Agar, no run defended away to point this time
Swann to Hughes, no run Hughes defends from off stump
Swann to Hughes, no run drifting in and Hughes defends, at times he doesn't look as solid as Agar at the other end, but they are both getting the job done
Swann to Hughes, no run defended safely to point
Swann to Hughes, no run Swann is getting plenty of drift, but Hughes defends comfortably
Swann to Hughes, no run quicker and flatter, trying to get through the defence of Hughes, but he keeps it out
Swann to Hughes, no run wider of off and turning away, Hughes shoulders arms. He's happy for Agar to face up at the other end, and why wouldn't you be?
Anderson to Agar, no run good start from Anderson, fullish and a hint of inswing, Agar drives but doesn't time it
Anderson to Agar, 3 runs again Anderson bowls full on the stumps, Agar is good enough to drive this through midwicket - doesn't time it well enough for a boundary but picks up three
Anderson to Hughes, 2 runs Anderson attacks the stumps again and Hughes waits on it, driving straight back past the bowler
Anderson to Hughes, 1 run Anderson was over the wicket to Agar but he's around the wicket to Hughes, who clips one off his pads
Anderson to Agar, 1 run Agar winds up for a pull as Anderson drops a little shorter, but doesn't time this one
Anderson to Hughes, 1 run cut away through point
Swann to Hughes, no run Hughes defends to the off side
Swann to Hughes, 1 run drifts on to the pads and they scamper through for a quick single as Hughes pushes past short leg
Swann to Agar, no run flatter and straight from Swann, but Agar is good enough to defend it
Swann to Agar, no run turning outside off, trying to tempt the drive but Agar leaves it
Swann to Agar, no run again drifts it in just outside off, this time Agar pushes it away to point
Swann to Agar, no run easily defended by Agar
Anderson to Hughes, 1 run tucked away off the hips for a single to fine leg
Anderson to Agar, 1 run swinging down leg and Agar flicks a single off his pads
Anderson to Hughes, 1 run the gaps just seem to be everywhere in the field now, Hughes punches off the back foot to deep point for a single
Anderson to Agar, no run a big shout for lbw from Anderson, but that was out of hope more than anything. He's coming over the wicket and that pitched some considerable distance outside leg
Anderson to Agar, no run a touch shorter and Agar has had a crack at the big pull - but he mistimes it and bunts it to midwicket

Anderson to Agar, 2 runs that's the half-century for Agar! He's the first No.11 in Test history to achieve that milestone on debut. He does it with a thick edge along the ground wide of slips, it's collected at third man but they get back for two
Swann to Hughes, no run defended away to the off side
Swann to Hughes, no run luring Hughes outside off, but it's just pushed back towards the bowler
Swann to Hughes, no run Hughes again just nudges it to the off side
Swann to Hughes, 1 run straighter from Swann, and Hughes pushes a single down towards long-on
Swann to Agar, SIX runs Ashton Agar is a confident young man! He has just lofted Swann over long-on for six - used his feet beautifully, and connected well enough to comfortably clear the boundary
Swann to Agar, 2 runs this time he goes along the ground past Swann, and picks up two runs, and that brings up Australia's 200

Anderson to Hughes, 1 run Hughes clips this one through midwicket, oh and nearly gets himself into trouble trying for a second run, the throw from the deep misses the stumps though and there's nobody there to collect it
Anderson to Agar, no run Agar defends solidly as ever, pushing the ball to cover
Anderson to Agar, no run on the stumps now, and Agar defends
Anderson to Agar, 1 run short ball, pulled away to deep square leg but the sweeper keeps it to one
Anderson to Hughes, 2 runs on the pads and clipped through leg, good running from Hughes and Agar as they turn that into two to the man in the deep
Anderson to Hughes, 1 run big cheers around the ground now as Hughes tucks a single to the leg side and reaches his half-century
Swann to Hughes, 1 run a little too full now, and Hughes flicks a low full toss through midwicket for a single
Swann to Agar, no run tossed up outside off, Swann is trying to tempt Agar, who defends
Swann to Agar, FOUR runs bad ball this time from Swann, too short, and Agar has just pulled this powerfully through midwicket for four more
Swann to Agar, no run defended away to the off side
Swann to Agar, FOUR runs lovely late cut! Agar plays this late enough that it runs away fine to third man for a boundary, and the scores are now level. Extraordinary
Swann to Agar, no run safely defended again
Broad to Hughes, no run good line to start with, just outside off and Hughes defends it to off
Broad to Hughes, no run again Hughes pushes to the off side
Broad to Hughes, FOUR runs and Australia have taken a first-innings lead! Broad gives Hughes some width, and he opens up with an expansive cover-drive that runs away to the boundary
Broad to Hughes, FOUR runs edged and there is no second slip in place! Consequently, that runs away for another boundary. Would have been a regulation catch for second slip
Broad to Hughes, no run Broad attacks the stumps now and Hughes defends
Broad to Hughes, FOUR runs Hughes loves to get width outside off! Cuts this confidently behind point and that is another boundary, all the way along the ground
Swann to Agar, no run tossed up outside off, but it's left alone
Swann to Agar, no run defended by Agar
Swann to Agar, no run driven towards cover, Agar can't find the gap this time
Swann to Agar, 1 run nudged away behind point for a single
Swann to Hughes, no run Hughes shuffles across outside off to defend
Swann to Hughes, no run tossed up on off stump and Hughes defends once more
Broad to Agar, no run well wide of off, and Agar leaves it alone
Broad to Agar, no run probing just outside off - it's the right line with two slips now - but Agar is good enough to defend
Broad to Agar, no run just outside off again, Agar bunts it straight down into the turf
Broad to Agar, 1 run on the back foot, Agar punches a single to deep point
Broad to Hughes, no run angling across Hughes and trying to tempt him, but he leaves it alone
Broad to Hughes, no run on the stumps, Hughes negotiates it, and that's the session over
Anderson to Agar, no run full just outside off stump, forward firmly and blocked into the covers
Anderson to Agar, 1 run leg stump length ball, clipped down to long leg
Anderson to Hughes, 2 runs middle and leg line, worked backward of square and they get another couple
Anderson to Hughes, 4 leg byes full on the leg stump, clips the pads and runs to fine leg
Anderson to Hughes, 1 run middle and leg again, clipped out to deep square leg
Anderson to Agar, 1 run more runs through the leg side, clipped through square leg
Broad to Agar, FOUR runs back of a length just outside off stump, slapped hard through midwicket and that's four more, nicely timed
Broad to Agar, no run blocked forward around the off stump into the covers
Broad to Agar, no run pushed square on the off side again forward from off stump
Broad to Agar, no run fuller and driven from off stump to mid-off
Broad to Agar, FOUR runs full on leg stump and this is clipped away for four more past midwicket, more excellent timing
Broad to Agar, 1 run forward and dabbed into the covers and they get another single
Anderson to Agar, no run full on the stumps, played forward and pushed up to mid-off
Anderson to Agar, no run good length ball on off stump, blocked out to point playing quite late
Anderson to Agar, 2 runs forward, opens the face and guides is behind square on the off side
Anderson to Agar, FOUR runs full on middle and leg and flashed past mid-on, what a stroke! A flamingo flick down the ground, super timing
Anderson to Agar, no run forward on off stump, pressed into the covers
Anderson to Agar, no run very full just outside off stump, dug out into the covers
Broad to Hughes, 1 run back of a length outside off stump, cut hard backward of square and they get, just a single in fact as the sweeper comes around to field
Broad to Agar, no run around the wicket, full and punched up to mid-off
Broad to Agar, 1 run full on off stump, driven hard and runs it out to deep point
Broad to Hughes, no run full length on off stump, covered up and dropped into midwicket
Broad to Hughes, FOUR runs straight driven and beats Pietersen's dive at mid-off to his left, the stroke is well timed so four more, lovely shot
Broad to Hughes, 1 run middle and leg, clipped through square leg
Anderson to Hughes, 2 runs length on middle and leg, tucked into the on side and they get a couple more
Anderson to Hughes, no run full and forward just outside off, pushed hard to mid-off
Anderson to Hughes, 2 runs hint of width outside off stump, Hughes stays back and carves it behind point, the sweeper runs to his right and they take two
Anderson to Hughes, no run tight off stump line, pushed back up the wicket
Anderson to Hughes, no run covered up around middle and off
Anderson to Hughes, no run full off stump delivery, a flick of the wrists on the front foot to mid-off
Broad to Agar, 1 run full on off stump, pushed hard just wide of mid-off so they get a quick single
Broad to Hughes, no run full on off stump, forward and driven hard to extra cover
Broad to Hughes, 2 runs full just outside off, straight driven, timed reasonably down the ground, Pietersen goes back to field
Broad to Hughes, 1 run flicked off the legs down to long leg
Broad to Agar, no run bumper, well directed, just about gets himself under it
Broad to Agar, 3 runs pulled in the air but safe wide of deep square leg
Swann to Agar, no run spin past the outside edge playing forward, an absolute beauty, turn off the straight and narrowly misses the outside edge and off stump
Swann to Agar, no run forward again, connects with this and runs it back up the wicket
Swann to Agar, no run down the wicket, didn't get there and ends up blocking it back to Swann
Swann to Agar, no run a big swing outside off, it goes to first slip but it's all turn, no edge
Swann to Agar, 1 run played forward just outside off, runs it off an inside edge to short long leg, nearly snuck through
Swann to Hughes, 1 run forward just outside off, pushed into the covers and they take a single
Broad to Hughes, no run length ball on off stump, blocked up the wicket playing in the crease
Broad to Hughes, no run fuller and driven from just outside off, gets it to cover off low on the bat
Broad to Hughes, no run similar length but a touch straighter, this is driven to mid-off without timing again
Broad to Hughes, 1 run full ball on middle and leg, clipped out to deep square leg
Broad to Agar, no run back of a length from around the wicket and Agar lets it hit him on the arms as it runs into midwicket
Broad to Agar, 1 run short again, really well played, gets right on top of it and turns it around the corner for an easy single
Swann to Agar, 3 runs forward and ran off a thick outside edge, they charge back for three
Swann to Hughes, no run pressed forward from outside off into the covers
Swann to Hughes, no run tossed up again, blocked into the covers again playing forward
Swann to Hughes, no run forward opens the face a little and runs it behind point but no run
Swann to Hughes, no run straighter and pushed up on the on side on the front foot
Swann to Hughes, no run floated right up, dug out into the gully
Broad to Agar, no run bumper, nice and straight, ducked, somewhat telegraphed was that delivery
Broad to Agar, 2 runs back of a length, gets inside it and dabs behind square, has he found the third man fence? No the deep point comes around to field
Broad to Agar, no run back of a length down the leg side, swings at it and misses
Broad to Agar, no run short again, wafts at it trying to force it down to third man past gully but missed

Broad to Agar, OUT back of a length, pulled and...got him!! Oh no, caught in the deep. A miscue aiming to the midwicket boundary but didn't get it and Graeme Swann came in and took a low catch. He came so close, having played so well, but Agar has fallen just short of an historical century but it's still the highest Test score by a No.

So England can breathe a huge sigh of relief to have finally ended the innings but goodness me what a turnaround from 117 for 9. No-one could have imagine something like that would happen for the final wicket but Phil Hughes and Ashton Agar have put Australia right in the game.
